data.destination: Bangkok - Kanchanaburi - Ayutthaya - Chiang Mai - Ko Samui
data.modules: Bangkok, Oriental City - Kanchanaburi: Bridge over River Kwai - Historic city Ayutthaya - Chiang Mai: cool in many ways - Ko Samui: east coast islands
data.name: Highlights of Thailand

Services.ser_name: Suvarnabhumi Airport To Hotel In Bangkok
Services.ser_description: Private transfer with Thai driver from Suvarnabhumi Airport to Hotel in Bangkok

Sabye Bangkok hotel is located in an old community called "Ban Phan Tom" which is part of Rattanakosin Island. It is peacefully surrounded by many cultural attractions such as the Grand Palace, Temple of the Emerald Buddha (Wat Phra Kaew), Bowonniwet Vihara temple (Wat Bowonniwet Vihara), the National Museum, the National Gallery, Chao Fah road, and other tourist attractions along Kao Sarn road.

Sabye Bangkok hotel was once an old commercial building with 2 floors and 9 rooms. The structure was half concrete and half timber which is a popular Thai building style of the past. There are still evidences of the past reflected through the floors, the walls, and the furniture. Sabye Bangkok Hotel includes a line-up of 23 rooms, featuring three different types and three different color themes. Room types include Standard, Superior, and Deluxe together; they integrate to create the overall design and experience of the hotel. All the rooms includes all the comforts, amenities and quality standards.

Sabye Bangkok hotel is located in an old community called "Ban Phan Tom" which is part of Rattanakosin Island. It is peacefully surrounded by many cultural attractions such as the Grand Palace, Temple of the Emerald Buddha (Wat Phra Kaew), Bowonniwet Vihara temple (Wat Bowonniwet Vihara), the National Museum, the National Gallery, Chao Fah road, and other tourist attractions along Kao Sarn road.

Sabye Bangkok hotel was once an old commercial building with 2 floors and 9 rooms. The structure was half concrete and half timber which is a popular Thai building style of the past. There are still evidences of the past reflected through the floors, the walls, and the furniture. Sabye Bangkok Hotel includes a line-up of 23 rooms, featuring three different types and three different color themes. Room types include Standard, Superior, and Deluxe together; they integrate to create the overall design and experience of the hotel. All the rooms includes all the comforts, amenities and quality standards.

This morning, after breakfast, meet your guide and driver, and begin your journey by visiting Wat Po, one of Bangkok’s oldest and largest temples, we’ll be there just in time for the monk chanting! Next, we’ll have a look at Lak Muang, Bangkok’s city pillar, a not often frequented place by tourists.

The highlights of this morning’s program are the Grand Palace and the Temple of the Emerald Buddha (Wat Pra Kaew), the most revered shrine in the Kingdom. After a break for a typical Thai lunch at a local restaurant we board a longtail boat to explore the ‘klongs’, Bangkok’s maze of canals and waterways. You will see parts of Thai traditional life which have disappeared from most of Bangkok.
Back on the Chao Phraya we end the day with a visit of Wat Arun, the Temple of Dawn.
You'll be back at the hotel late this afternoon.
Private transfer with Thai driver from Airport to hotel in Kanchanaburi

Surrounded by a well-kept garden and located on the bank of the River Kwae, PLOY Resort in Kanchaburi is an ideal place for relaxation. 

We offer a cozy, peace, cleanful air-condition rooms – tastefully designed in an elegant & romantic Siam Style. Ploy Resort, Kanchanaburi	

Enjoy the unforgettable views of mountains and the River Kwae while swimming or dining on the terrace at sun set. 

Feel yourself at home – you are invited to cook your food by yourself. We are pleased to give you a helping hand and the necessary ingredients to cook a delicious Thai meal.

Ayothaya Riverside is a 3* hotel that overlooks the Pasak River. It is surrounded by the pictorial atmosphere of Ayothaya which has been declared a city of world heritage. It is also conveniently situated across The Railway Station and therefore specifically suitable for those traveling by train. The eight storey hotel is decorated in contemporary Thai style, all 102 guest rooms are fully air conditioned and have wall to wall carpeting.

It is also conveniently situated across The Railway Station and therefore specifically suitable for those traveling by train. Services.ser_description:
Located in the old secter of Chiang Mai town with just a few-minute walk to day and night markets The Small, is a quaint and trendy hotel with concept of “Loft Art” design. The Smalls’ design encompasses Asian art blending traditional Thai and ‘Loft” style. 

     Nearby The Small is a heaven of quaint boutiques, art shops, antique galleries and coffee houses for all tastes and desires with restaurants featuring all styles of the famous Thai cuisine. Walking around our neighborhoods is an enchanting journey through a mix of ‘old Chiang Mai’ with the international flavor of an eclectic art area.

The Small, Chiang Mai accommodation is divided into 8 Petit and 27 Plus Petit rooms, all featuring high-tech television, DVD Player, mini bar, special design. 
local handicraft decor, colorful painting floors, and local artwork wall prints.

Here at Ko Tao Resort we are ever mindful of the environmental impact that mankind has on the planet. For this reason our rooms are located in low-impact areas and we have a dedicated sewage system in an effort to minimize the threat that we pose to the beautiful natural world, both above and below the sea.


Along with the cleanliness, our beautifully laid out resort makes us the ideal choice for both couples and families wishing for an idyllic time away from home. Customer service is paramount to us. We provide the services that our customers want, from massage to scuba diving. We have 2 private swimming pools. One is an infinity pool in the centre of the resort. It is located just at the back of the beach. Onother is at our restaurant 'Chalok Habour'. Amazing sunsets can be enjoyed whilst relaxing here. Our food is delicious, we buy our food supplies in fresh daily. Large parties or special dietary needs may be arranged upon request.

Modules.bok_module_description:
- Explore the historic area in the city of Bangkok, <br />- Observe Buddhism in daily life, <br />- See old neighbourhoods, glittering temples, hidden alleyways and more<br /><br />This Bangkok introduction is for all: if you have never visited the city, or if you love Thailand so much and keep coming back, Bangkok's full of great experiences and you will never get bored seeing some of its major sights. Its high-rise buildings, heavy traffic congestion, intense heat and 
naughty nightlife do not immediately give you a warm welcome — but don't
 let your first impression mislead you. It is one of Asia's most 
cosmopolitan cities with magnificent temples and palaces, authentic 
canals, busy markets and a vibrant nightlife that has something for 
everyone. You will stay in one of the interesting area's where daily life is at your doorstep. We will take you on a private city tour to feel the vibrance, the thrill, the heath and the serenity of this great Asian city (again). As it is private, those knowing the city, have a say in where you want to go and what to skip. Let the journey begin! <br />
Modules.bok_summary: 3 days in heat, vibrance and serenity

Itinerary.bit_description:
Arriving in Bangkok can be a bit overwhelming. There are endless express ways above the city, congested streets, towering skyscrapers, etc. You'll see this already during your transfer from the airport to your nice hotel in the heart of Bangkok. But Bangkok is one of the safest capital cities in Asia and it is actually relatively easy to step out of this hectic life and see a rather different, peaceful part of this amazing city. Especially in the old part of town, Rattanakosin Island, several districts such as Sam Prang have been spruced up and the old 2 storey shophouses freshly painted with lots of small local shop owners continuing their business like always. For a city of this size, Bangkok is surprisingly full of such quiet escapes. Just step out of the street noise and into the calm of one of the city's 400 wats (temple-monasteries) or take a river taxi on the Chao Phraya River. It is cheap while at the same time providing excellent standards. That goes for food as well as entertainment. Fun fact to know, the official name of Bangkok is the longest in the world, check the Guinness Book of Records!

Bangkok is a fascinating city and fun to explore on your own. Once you have checked in and refreshed a bit, time remaining today, enjoy a rooftop sunset drink at the Vertigo Bar on Satorn Road or go for a stroll in your hotel area, you'll discover plenty of things happening: Along the way you'll encounter food stalls, temples, street vendors and much more, a great introduction to Thailand.

This morning, after breakfast, meet your guide and driver, and begin your journey by visiting Wat Po, one of Bangkok’s oldest and largest temples, we’ll be there just in time for the monk chanting! Next, we’ll have a look at Lak Muang, Bangkok’s city pillar, a not often frequented place by tourists. The highlights of this morning’s program are the Grand Palace and the Temple of the Emerald Buddha (Wat Pra Kaew), the most revered shrine in the Kingdom. After a break for a typical Thai lunch at a local restaurant we board a longtail boat to explore the ‘klongs’, Bangkok’s maze of canals and waterways. You will see parts of Thai traditional life which have disappeared from most of Bangkok. Back on the Chao Phraya river, we end the day with a visit of the magical looking Wat Arun, the Temple of Dawn. You'll be back at the hotel late this afternoon.

The evening is at leisure, but you might be interested to explore the city's nightlife. Have a nice meal in one of the many riverside restaurants or dive into some quality nightlife on Sukhumvit's Soi 11, but make sure to be dressed up a little, most places don't go for shorts!

Today, depending on the time we pick you up to transfer you to your next destination, you have some free time. 

Check out time is usually 12.00 noon. In case you'd like to use your room longer, you can arrange a dayroom with the hotel's reception (we recommend you do this on the day of arrival). 

Then the journey continues.. inland you go!

Modules.bok_module_description: - Beautiful province towards the Burmese border<br />- Learn the history about the Bridge over River Kwai<br />- Ride the "Death Railway"<br /><br />Travel west after your stay in Bangkok. We take you towards the Burmese border to the historic town of Kanchanaburi. It lies at the banks of River Kwai, and there are lots of attractions here. The main sight of interest is the Bridge over the River Kwai, as the start of the infamous World War II Death Railway to Burma (now Myanmar), as well as the associated museums and war cemeteries. Thais also know Kanchanaburi as one of the most beautiful provinces in the country with easily accessible waterfalls and national parks. <b>You can change the experience in the itinerary tab to combine Kanchanaburi with the amazing Erawan Waterfalls. The superior hotel option is a river raft resort. </b>After Kanchanburi you can return to Bangkok, travel north to the temples of Ayutthaya, or south to Hua Hin; one of Thailand's most popular beach destinations, due to its proximity to Bangkok.<br /><br />

Itinerary.bit_description:
"Welcome to your comfortable Kanchanaburi riverside hotel! After check in you can relax in their garden, take a dip in the pool or just enjoy the river scene with a refreshing drink. Kanchanaburi is a town in the west of Thailand, located where the Khwae Noi and Khwae Yai rivers converge into the Mae Klong river and is a popular spot for travelers. 
The city has two major commercial districts: the downtown area consists of a grid of several streets with office buildings, shop fronts, and a shopping mall; and the riverfront area businesses are mostly located further west along River Kwai Road.
Attractions include Bridge over the River Kwai, Death Railway, War Cemeteries, and the Thailand-Burma Railway Museum. Kanchanaburi province offers waterfalls, national parks and the infamous Hell-Fire Pass."

Today you will be picked up for a tour around Kanchanaburi town. The war museum, cemetery and of course the famous Bridge over River Kwai will all be visited and you will learn about the history of this place and what it has meant for today's life. Kanchanaburi is a very beautiful province, so if you like, you have time this afternoon to stroll next to the river or take a tuk-tuk or taxi into the surrounding nature.

Today (depending on the departure time of your next destination) you have the morning free until check out time, usually 12.00 noon. In case you'd like to stay a bit longer you can arrange on own a dayroom with the hotel's reception.

Modules.bok_module_description: - Explore Ayutthaya World Heritage Site<br />- Cycle in the countryside and enjoy a lunch river cruise<br /><br />Ayutthaya is only a few hours from Bangkok and it has spectacular remains of bygone kingdoms. Only Angkor Wat in Cambodia, and Sukothai in the north exceed the offer. You will discover this by bike and boat. The temples in Ayutthaya are particularly attractive during sunset, when the already red bricks are turning in pink and purple shades, adding to its mysterious atmosphere. After Ayutthaya, you can continue to Khao Yai (jungle jeep safari), take the train north to Sukothai and/or Chiang Mai or return to Bangkok to continue your trip elsewhere.<br />
Modules.bok_summary: 3 days bike and boat between temples

Itinerary.bit_description:
Welcome to Ayutthaya, after checking in your nice hotel why not go for a refreshing dip in the pool with an exotic cocktail afterwards?! Depending on your mood you can explore the old town and its many ruins a bit on your own already in the afternoon. Especially just before the sunset the ancient temple ruins look truly magical.

Ayutthaya was the Thai capital from 1350, and 33 kings of various Siamese dynasties reigned here until the city was conquered by the Burmese in 1767.
The old capital was frequently visited by Dutch, Portuguese, French, English, Chinese and Japanese merchants. By the end of the 17th century, Ayutthaya's population had reached one million and virtually all visiting foreigners claimed it to be the most illustrious city they had ever seen.
Ayutthaya's scattered temples and ruins have been declared a World Heritage Site. The long list includes the 14th century Wat Phra Si Sanphet, the largest in Ayuthaya in its time, which once contained a 16m standing Buddha that was covered in 250 kg of gold. Standing right on the river, Wat Chai Wattanaram is one of the most impressive of the remaining monuments of old Ayutthaya. Wat Phra Mahathat was built in the early days of Ayutthaya in the late 14th century and is famous for its Buddha head in a tree.

After breakfast you will experience a great bike & boat tour! Select your bicycle and at 09:30 AM start your journey with an English speaking guide through Ayutthaya, experiencing the highlights of the historical parts, such as Wihan Phra Mongkhon Bopit, Wat Phra Si Sanphet and the Ancient Palace, Wat Na Phra Main and Wat Mahathat.

Around noon it’s time to change transport, get on board of a converted rice barge and cruise Ayutthaya’s waterways while enjoying a Thai lunch.

Back on land the trip ends at 16:30 PM after having enjoyed an 1,5 hour traditional relaxing Thai massage at Baan Suwantara while overlooking the river. Fully relaxed you return on own to your hotel.

Today (depending on the departure time of your next destination) you have the morning free until check out time, usually 12.00 noon. In case you'd like to stay longer you can arrange on own a dayroom with the hotel's reception.

Modules.bok_module_description: This 4-day module includes a day in Thailands second city, appealing Chiang Mai, and 2 days private trekking with guide in northern Thailand. It is a real adventure: you will stay 1 night in a fantastically located hilltribe village with great views over the forest and the valleys (weather permitting). The trekking is challenging but beautiful. We pass several spectacular waterfalls and trek through evergreen forest. The trip ends with a fabulous white water raft trip on the Mae Taeng River followed by some gentle bamboo rafting.

Parent.bok_description: Chiang Mai: cool in many ways
Parent.bok_module_description: - Visit the northern gateway: charming Chiang Mai<br />- Get up close and personal with the elephants here<div>- Learn about ethnic northern cultures and traditions.</div><div><br /></div><div>These 4 days in the north, you can explore   ancient <i>Lanna style</i> temples and local fresh markets in the city of Chiang Mai. Not only the night bazar will stimulate all of your (shopping) senses, be amazed by the sounds,   smells &amp; colours you'll encounter in this vibrant city. From Chiang Mai, you will take a tour into the countryside to interact   with the locals while hiking through stunning nature and learning about a forest   restoration project. Also you will learn   to be a elephant handler for a day, how to feed &amp; wash them and about the   background of the Asian Elephants, a unique and complete northern Thailand experience. <b>Select this module, then change the experience in the itinerary tab if you want a shorter stay in Chiang Mai, or if you want to combine Chiang Mai with an overnight trekking in the surrounding mountains.</b><br /></div>

Itinerary.bit_description:
Upon arrival in Chiang Mai you will be met and taken to a fine hotel in Chiang Mai. Perhaps you would just like (after check in) to relax by the pool with an exotic cocktail, in that case one of their friendly waiters would be more than happy to bring you one. Once recovered you can get ready to hit the town! Chiang Mai, Thailand's second-largest city and the gateway to the country's north, was founded in 1296.

You can still see the moat that encircled the original city, and there are 300 wats (temples), including Wat Chiang Man, Wat Phra Singh and Wat Chedi Luang.

15km west of the city, Wat Doi Suthep, 1,156 m above sea level on Suthep Mountain, overlooks the city from its forested backdrop. It is one of Chiang Mai’s most important landmarks. To reach it one can chose the hard way and climb a steep Naga staircase comprising of around 300 steps or the less energetic may ascend by funicular cars. From here one can have fine views of the city.

The Old Chiang Mai Cultural Centre was set up over 25 years ago to preserve and promote the history and culture of the ancient northern kingdom of Lan Na, its royal tradition of dances and music, its unique food and the folk art of the people of the valleys and of the hilltribes. Compared to Bangkok, Chiang Mai's evenings are cool and conducive to browsing around the central Night Bazaar. To get value for money, bargain patiently, but keep things in perspective.

Itinerary.bit_title: Trekking Day 1: Chiang Mai – Kub Kab Village Meals: L D
Itinerary.bit_description:
Your trekking guide will pick you up at an appointed time at the hotel. You will drive to the north into the mountains near Chiang Dao. First we will stop at a local market. Your guide will do some shopping for the coming days. He will take you along and will explain about the different ingredients he will be using for dinner. Drive to Huay Sri from where we take a rural road to Keng Keud.

We will have lunch in the village before we start trekking. We pass a small elephant camp before we reach a small waterfall. We continue walking uphill through the forest. Now and then we are rewarded with fantastic views. The last part of the trek today we walk through corn- and ricefields until we reach the Red Lahu village Kub Kab. After arrival in the village you can relax, explore the village or learn some Thai cooking by helping your guide prepare the dinner. He can explain you about the herbs and ingredients he uses. After dinner your guide will take you to one of the village houses where you will meet some of the villagers. Overnight will be in one of the village houses.

Itinerary.bit_title: Trekking Day 2: Kub Kab Village – Chiang Mai Meals: B L
Itinerary.bit_description:
After the sounds of nature and the locals woke you up, your guide will prepare breakfast. After breakfast we start hiking along a trail with nice views over the forest until we reach the Chinese village Huay Sathan where we will rest for a short while. We continue trekking to the first stage of the Huay Sathan waterfall. We trek along the Kub Kab River to the second stage of the waterfall where we can have a swim and have lunch. After lunch it is not far to the Mae Taeng River where our rafts will be waiting. We start with an exhilarating white water raft trip in rubber boats. After this adventure we make a relaxing bamboo raft trip.

Drive back to Chiang Mai by truck. Our last stop on the way back will be at one of Chiang Mai’s famous orchid nurseries. We will drop you at your hotel at around 5 pm.

Today (depending on the departure time of your next destination) you have the morning free until check out time, usually 12.00 noon. In case you'd like to stay a bit longer you can arrange on own a dayroom with the hotel's reception.

Modules.bok_description: Ko Samui + dive island Ko Tao
Modules.bok_module_description:
Enjoy stunning beaches, great   snorkeling and tropical nature<br />
Explore   Ang Thong National Marine Park; 42 islands featuring lime stone massifs,   tropical rainforests and deserted beaches.<br />Dive!<br /><br />First you visit Koh Samui, vibrant, romantic and with endless beautiful beaches. Then we take you by ferry to Ko Tao, a much smaller island which is famous for diving and snorkeling. Many tourists go here to get there diving license, very affordable to do that here (you can add days to the module if your clients are interested). Flip flops out, transportation is mainly by scooter or open jeep, fish is on the menu and full moons are divine. Welcome to paradise...<br />
Modules.bok_summary: 5 days Ko Samui & Ko Tao combi

Parent.bok_module_description:
- Popular, <b>year-round</b> beach destination in southeast Thailand <br /> - Chaweng and Lamai beaches offer vibrant night life<br />                                - Ang Thong Marine Park; rainforest islands with lime stone massifs &amp; deserted beaches.<br /><br />Ko Samui is Thailand's second-largest island (25 km at its widest point) after Phuket. It features white sandy beaches, coral reefs and coconut trees. It is surrounded by the Ang Thong Marine 
National Park. The expansion of tourism in Ko Samui has resulted in growth in building 
resorts, bungalows and luxury private villas on the island. But Ko Samui is not famous for nothing, it still is 
an oasis of natural beauty with its great beaches, dazzling coral,
 luscious lagoons, picturesque waterfalls and 
crystal clear water.<b> Change the experience on the Itinerary tab, to find combinations of Ko Samui with Ko Pha Ngan and Ko Tao</b>. Most travelers fly home after this relaxing stay. If you need to connect in Bangkok, please check if you need the 'Connection Bangkok'
 module (1 night) to the itinerary.

Itinerary.bit_description:
"Upon arrival you will be met and taken to your cool Samui hotel. After check in relax with a tropical drink at the pool or enjoy a stroll along the beach! Koh Samui - ""the island of the coconut tree"" is Thailand's 3rd largest. A backpacker's secret for years, this sun lover's paradise, with its coconut plantations, rolling hills, curved sandy beaches and offshore islands, has gradually developed into a holiday destination with a distinctly local island flavour.
Samui is a place to relax, meet people, sunbathe and party. Nightlife is good with open-air discos, music bars and good restaurants. The island retains its laid back feel, with friendly and welcoming locals, good food and offbeat local attractions which haven't become over commercialized."
Today is a free day which you can spend at the beach, but why not do something different and go on tour? The Angthong Marine National Park is an amazing place to spend time snorkeling!

Itinerary.bit_title: Bye bye Koh Samui, hello Koh Tao
Itinerary.bit_description: After a relaxed free morning it is check out time and your driver is waiting for you at 11.30 AM to bring you to the pier. The boat to Koh Tao takes about two hours. Upon arrival you will be met and taken to your comfortable hotel,  just check in and you're ready for relax time!  Why not try one of the cool cocktails, take a dive in the pool, treat yourself to a sensual spa treatment or just hit straight for the beach, it' all possible! Once the haunt of sea-turtles, the small island of Koh Tao with its quiet beaches has become a favourite destination both of paradise seekers and divers who come for the best coral diving in the area.
Today is a free day which you can spend at the beach, or explore more of the island by yourself.

Time to say goodbye to all these wonderful islands! Be ready for your transfer to the pier at 08.30 AM. Your boat will return to Koh Samui, but first stops at Koh Phangan to take on/drop off passengers. Upon arrival there's a short transfer to Samui's charming airport and after checking in you can relax in comfort before flying back to Bangkok.
